revised_title: Photosensitized Decomposition of Nitrogen Trichloride by Chlorine
tldr: The authors conducted experiments using flash photolysis to study the decomposition of nitrogen trichloride photosensitized by chlorine. They discovered two transient absorption spectra in the regions of 2400 and 2950 Å, which were caused by the photosensitizing action of chlorine. The study provides insights into the chemical reactions and spectroscopic properties of nitrogen trichloride and chlorine.
